alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 12:29AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Yuma County through 100 AM MDT... At 1229 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Highland Center, or 17 miles north of Yuma, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Yuma County, including the following locations... Alvin, Clarkville and Wauneta. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 254 and 270. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
